column1: Uchi////So we finally get seated and we had some stellar dishes (hama chili
column3: scallop nigiri that contained the world's creamiest scallop) and we had some dishes that literally got spit out. Â The funny thing is that when we told our waiter we hated one of them
column4: he said something about how in a recent meeting they told the servers not to bring out all the "good dishes" at once. Huh? Shouldn't all the dishes
column5: in the opinion of the chef at least
column6: be good? I recognize people have different tastes
column7: but shouldn't a restaurant stand behind what it's serving?
